text: The legendary Shieldmaiden of Skjold is as much the King's asset as her popularity is his threat.
With a mighty cry Oda organizes her Huskarls and Shield-Maidens in line, forming an impenetrable wall of shields and meat.
Norscans flock to Horvenghaast to trade and partake in the famed "Duelling Circles," rooftop fighting rituals sacred to Khorne.
Oda Winterclaw has sailed every corner of the Bjornling coast, serving as it's guardian and champion.
Steel imported from Pack Ice Bay is used to forge the finest shields for the King's frontlines.
The deep bellows of Oda's Horn break winds and clouds as they invigor friendly troops.
Not many are trusted with dealing with the High King's affairs, yet as his trusted advisor Oda deals with trivial mundane management such as keeping the savage marauders in check.
The elite of Skjold are the Huskarls and Shield Maidens that follow Oda in to battle, often trained on the towering island of Horvenghaast.
A rival champion once muttered: "No living man may hinder me". His head now rests on Oda's mantle.

“No wall stood that day — but she did.”

Forged in secret during the Long Cold by the shieldmaidens of Skjold, Skjoldrheim is more than a shield — it is a symbol of lineage, sacrifice, and survival. Crafted from lack alderwood soaked in glacier-water, reinforced with riveted storm-steel, and bound with braided horsehair, its surface bears no heraldry. Instead, it is carved with deep runes of defiance and ancestral oathmarks — each notch a battle stood, not fled. Passed down through the matriarchal lines of shieldmaidens, the shield was said to have once held fast against a three-day siege at the Howling Steps
Sworn to the storm and cast with purpose, it never falters, never veers, and never misses.

Forged in the howling winds atop the Cliffs of Skjold, this spear bears ancient runes that bind it to the northern gales and the will of the Valkyries. When hurled by Oda Winterclaw, Hrafnsvartr becomes a streak of silver fury, its oath-bound course unbroken by shield, spell, or stone. It is said the spear listens only to Oda’s hand and the winds that guide it, returning to her grip when her enemies lie pierced and broken. To see it thrown is to glimpse the wrath of the storm made manifest.
